sen.j: 木目込人形（きめこみにんぎょう）とは木製の人形の一種である。
sen.e: Kimekomi ningyo is a type of wooden dolls.
Kimekomi ningyo is a type of wooden doll.
Kimekomi ningyo is a type of wooden doll.

sen.j: 桐塑または木で作られた人形に、衣服の皺や模様の形に本体に筋彫りを入れ、
sen.e: To make a kimekomi ningy, first, thin lines are carved to represent wrinkles and patterns on the doll body which was made with wood or toso (made from the mixture of sawdust of paulownia wood and wheat starch or other sticky materials.

To make a kimekomi ningyo, first, thin lines are carved to represent wrinkles and patterns on the doll body which is made of wood or toso (made from the mixture of sawdust of paulownia wood and wheat starch or other sticky materials.

To make a kimekomi ningyo, first, thin lines are carved to represent wrinkles and patterns on the doll body which is made of wood or toso (made from the mixture of sawdust of paulownia wood and wheat starch or other sticky materials.

sen.j: 筋彫りに目打ちなどで布の端を押し込んで衣装を着ているように仕立てた人形。
sen.e: Then pieces of fabric tucked into the carved grooves using an eyelet to make the doll look like wearing clothes.
Then pieces of fabric tucked into the carved grooves using an eyelet to make the doll look like it is wearing clothes.
Then pieces of fabric are tucked into the carved grooves using an eyelet to make the doll look like it is wearing clothes.
sen.cmt: tucked→are tucked ご確認願います。

sen.j: この、筋彫りに布の端を押し込む動作を「木目込む（決め込む）」ということから、木目込み人形と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: The name "kimekomi" came from the Japanese verb that describes the action of squeezing a piece of fabric into the groove on the wood, "kimekomu," which can be written with different Chinese characters to give different meaning, "determined."

The name "kimekomi" came from the Japanese verb that describes the action of squeezing a piece of fabric into the wood grooves, "kimekomu," which can be written with different Chinese characters to give different meaning, "determined."

The name 'kimekomi' came from the Japanese verb that describes the action of squeezing a piece of fabric into the wood grooves, 'kimekomu,' which can be written with different Chinese characters to give different meaning, 'determined.'

sen.j: 全身が桐塑で出来ているものと、頭を別に作り、完成した胴体に差し込んだものとがある。
sen.e: Some dolls are made all from toso; other dolls are made by inserting a head, which was made separately, into the completed torso.
Some dolls are made completely from toso; other dolls are made by inserting a head, made separately, into the completed torso.
Some dolls are made all from toso; other dolls are made by inserting a head, which was made separately, into the completed torso.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 頭を別に仕立てる場合でも目にはガラスを入れず、描き目であることが多い。
sen.e: In the case that the head is made separately, eyes are often drawn rather than placing glass balls.
When the head is made separately, eyes are often drawn rather than inserting glass eyes.
When the head is made separately, eyes are often drawn rather than inserting glass eyes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 京都府の上賀茂神社に仕える雑掌高橋忠重が、木切れに布を木目込んで人形を作ったのが始まりとされている。
sen.e: It is considered that kimekomi doll originated when Tadashige TAKAHASHI, an odd-job man who was working for Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, Kyoto Prefecture, started making dolls using fabric tucked into a piece of wood.

It is considered that kimekomi doll originated when Tadashige TAKAHASHI, an odd-job man who was working for Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, Kyoto Prefecture, started making dolls using fabric tucked into a pieces of wood.

It is considered that kimekomi doll originated when Tadashige TAKAHASHI, an odd-job man who was working for Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, Kyoto Prefecture, started making dolls using fabric tucked into a pieces of wood.

sen.j: 雛人形や七福神といったヒトガタの人形のほか、干支飾りや観賞用の手鞠なども存在する。
sen.e: Besides human-shaped dolls, such as hina dolls (dolls displayed for the Girl's Festival) or shichifukujin (Seven Deities of Good Fortune), there are Chinese zodiac ornaments and ornamental temari (a ball of cotton wound tightly around with threads of many colors).

Besides human-shaped dolls, such as hina dolls (dolls displayed for the Girl's Festival) or shichifukujin (Seven Deities of Good Fortune), there are Chinese zodiac ornaments and ornamental temari (a ball of cotton wound tightly around with threads of many colors).

Besides human-shaped dolls, such as hina dolls (dolls displayed for the Girl's Festival) or shichifukujin (Seven Deities of Good Fortune), there are Chinese zodiac ornaments and ornamental temari (a ball of cotton wound tightly around with threads of many colors).

sen.j: 種類
sen.e: Types
Types

sen.j: 加茂人形（かもにんぎょう）
sen.e: Kamo dolls
Kamo dolls
Kamo dolls

sen.j: - 加茂川人形（かもがわにんぎょう）とも。
sen.e: Also called Kamogawa dolls.
Also called Kamogawa dolls.
Also called Kamogawa dolls.

sen.j: 高橋忠重およびその子孫が作った人形。
sen.e: Dolls made by Hiroshige TAKAHASHI and his descendants.
Dolls made by Hiroshige TAKAHASHI and his descendants.
Dolls made by Hiroshige TAKAHASHI and his descendants.

sen.j: 現存数は少ない。
sen.e: There are only few remaining.
There are only a few remaining.
There are only a few remaining.

sen.j: 大きさが3cm-10cmと、とても小さいのが特徴。
sen.e: They are characterized by the small size, from 3cm to 10cm.
They are characterized by the small size, from 3cm to 10cm.
They are characterized by the small size, from 3cm to 10cm.

sen.j: 全身が柳などの木で出来ており、人間に近い表情をしている。
sen.e: All parts of the doll are made with willow and other wood, having complexions similar to real humans.
All parts of the doll are made of willow and other types of wood, having complexions similar to real humans.
All parts of the doll are made of willow and other types of wood, having complexions similar to real humans.

sen.j: 真多呂人形（またろにんぎょう）
sen.e: Mataro dolls.
Mataro dolls.
Mataro dolls.

sen.j: 江戸木目込み人形（えどきめこみにんぎょう）
sen.e: Edo Kimekomi dolls.
Edo Kimekomi dolls.
Edo Kimekomi dolls.

sen.j: - 木目込人形が正徳年間に江戸に伝わり、改良を加えられたもの。
sen.e: Kimekomi dolls were introduced to Edo during Shotoku era, and some improvements were made to them.
Kimekomi dolls were introduced to Edo during the Shotoku era, and some improvements were made to them.
Kimekomi dolls were introduced to Edo during the Shotoku era, and some improvements were made to them.

sen.j: 京都の木目込人形に比べ、やせ形で目鼻が小さいのが特徴。
sen.e: Edo Kimekomi dolls are characterized by having more slim body and smaller eyes and a nose compared with kimekomi dolls of Kyoto.
Edo Kimekomi dolls are characterized by having a slimmer body and smaller eyes and nose compared with kimekomi dolls of Kyoto.
Edo Kimekomi dolls are characterized by having a slimmer body and smaller eyes and nose compared with kimekomi dolls of Kyoto.

sen.j: 頭は桐塑または素焼きで出来ている。
sen.e: The head is made of toso or unglazed pottery.
The head is made of toso or unglazed pottery.
The head is made of toso or unglazed pottery.
